forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly clear, with a low around 46. West northwest wind around 10 mph, with gusts as high as 20 mph.

forecast.name: Monday
forecast.detailedForecast: Sunny. High near 56, with temperatures falling to around 54 in the afternoon. West northwest wind 8 to 16 mph, with gusts as high as 22 mph.

weather_report:
As dawn breaks over Downtown San Francisco, the air carries a crisp freshness, with the remnants of the night’s chill still lingering. The skies reveal themselves, mostly clear, unveiling a canvas of soft blues and warm whites that suggests a beautiful day ahead. With a low of 46 during the night, the city has begun to awaken, shaking off the cool embrace, preparing to greet a sunny Monday. As the sun rises higher, the anticipated high temperature of 56 brings not just warmth, but a promise of clarity, with the afternoon settling somewhere around 54, ensuring a pleasant experience for those venturing outdoors.

The winds, brisk yet gentle from the west-northwest at 8 to 16 mph, playfully tousle the hair and rustle the trees, with occasional gusts reminding one of their presence. Unlike many mornings cloaked in heavy fog, today’s atmosphere is remarkably clear, revealing the iconic sights from Sutro Tower— the Golden Gate Bridge shimmering in the distance, inviting one to embrace the outdoors. As you prepare to step out, consider a light jacket or layers, perfect for accommodating the variable temperatures throughout the day. It’s an ideal time for a leisurely walk along the waterfront, perhaps a visit to a local café to indulge in the simple joy of a warm beverage while soaking in the vibrant life this city offers.
